items.title: Welbeck scores as Brighton knock Man Utd out of FA Cup
items.summary: Striker Danny Welbeck helps Brighton dump his former club Manchester United out of the FA Cup at Old Trafford.

items.title: Daly and Hanson spark Villa comeback against Brighton
items.summary: Aston Villa score twice in two second-half minutes as they come from behind to beat Brighton in the Women's Super League.

items.title: Castellanos scores in extra time as West Ham edge past QPR
items.summary: Valentin 'Taty' Castellanos scores his first goal for West Ham United as they beat Queens Park Rangers in extra time and progress to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

items.title: Magic Makama hat-trick as Norwich beat Walsall
items.summary: Twenty-one-year-old Jovon Makama scores a hat-trick as Norwich City beat Walsall in the FA Cup third round.

items.title: Two for Reed as Mansfield upset Sheff Utd in thriller
items.summary: Mansfield Town cause one of the shocks of the FA Cup third round with a stunning victory over Sheffield United in a seven-goal thriller at Bramall Lane.

items.title: Chelsea kick off new year by thrashing West Ham
items.summary: Chelsea begin the new year with an impressive victory over West Ham in visiting manager Rita Guarino's first match in the Women's Super League.

items.title: Arsenal beat Portsmouth thanks to Martinelli hat-trick
items.summary: Gabriel Martinelli scores the first hat-trick of his senior career as an Arsenal side showing 10 changes come from a goal down to beat Championship side Portsmouth 4-1 in the FA Cup third round.

items.title: Man City beat Everton at home to strengthen grip on WSL title
items.summary: Manchester City consolidate their place at the top of the Women's Super League table with a convincing win over Everton.

items.title: Asus revised the liquid metal application on its $4,000 ROG Matrix RTX 5090 cards โ der8auer says retail versions come with 'much more professional' spread
items.summary: The retail versions of the ROG Matrix RTX 5090 shipping out to customers will come with an updated TIM application that should help against accidental liquid metal leakage. items.title: Leeds avoid upset with second-half comeback against Derby
items.summary: James Justin scored his first goal for Leeds United since joining from Leicester City in the summer, in a second-half comeback after Derby County took the lead thanks to a Ben Brereton Diaz strike.

items.title: Newegg bundles 16GB of DDR5-6000 RAM with Asus AM5 B850 mobo for under $240 โ get 41% off and save $169.99 with this all-white combo
items.summary: Newegg is basically throwing in an Asus B850 Max Gaming WiFi motherboard for $10 if you get this 16GB (2 x 8GB) Team Group DDR5-6000 RAM as a combo.

items.title: FCC approves 7,500 additional Starlink Gen2 satellites โ service will benefit from higher throughput and lower latency worldwide
items.summary: The FCC has partially approved a significant expansion of SpaceXโs next-generation Starlink constellation, authorizing 7,500 additional LEO satellites under a partial grant.

items.title: MetalPrinting Gauss MT90 3D printer offers officeโsafe metal printing without powders โ uses paste based metal extrusion (PME) tech
items.summary: MetalPrinting was at CES 2026 with its next-generation metal paste 3D printer dubbed the Gauss MT90.

items.title: Modder saves $130 by building 32GB DDR5 desktop DIMMs from scavenged laptop memory โ  donor modules soldered to bare PCB flashed with custom firmware even run XMP
items.summary: DIY DDR5 is no longer just a concept, but a reality, as modder VIK-on has built his first 32GB stick from scavenged parts. items.title: Windows Media Playerโs โfind album informationโ functionality has been removed โ youโll have to find other software for playing and ripping CDs with relevant track information
items.summary: Microsoft has quietly removed โfind album informationโ and โupdate album info onlineโ tools from the Media Player apps supplied with Windows 11.

items.title: US Department of Commerce lifts planned crackdown on Chinese drones, including DJI โ company gets reprieve ahead of Xi-Trump meeting in April, but the FCC ban still stands
items.summary: The U.S. Department of Commerce has retracted its proposal to stop the import of DJI drones, but the FCC's ban means that the U.S.'s doors are closed to new DJI models anyway.

items.title: AMD leaves the door open to experimental FSR Redstone support on RDNA 3
items.summary: At CES 2026, AMD used an interview with PCWorld to restate its official position on FSR Redstone while softening the edges around it.

items.title: Upgrade your gaming PC with an RTX 5060 for just $259.99 and instantly pocket $50 in savings
items.summary: The Gigabyte GeForce RTX 5060 WindForce OC 8G is currently on sale at BestBuy, giving you a 15% discount off Nvidia's $299 MSRP.

items.title: Doom conquers the kitchen through an electric cooking pot โ classic shooter runs seamlessly after a full device firmware refresh
items.summary: A YouTuber has managed to run Doom on a Krups Cook4Mec smart pressure cooker after dumping and reflashing the firmware on the applianceโs touchscreen control hardware.

items.title: Nvidiaโs Blackwell gaming GPUs go through blower-style transformation to fuel AI data centers โ RTX 5080, RTX 5070 Ti, RTX 5060 Ti blower GPUs up for purchase in China
items.summary: China's underground GPU operations have birthed a few more spectacles, new Nvidia RTX 50-series SKUs with blower-style coolers, aimed at data centers and server farms. items.title: Admins finally get the power to uninstall Microsoft Copilot on Windows 11 Pro, Enterprise, and EDU versions โ devices must meet specific conditions to allow the removal of the AI app
items.summary: Microsoft finally allows administrators to remove the Microsoft Copilot app from managed versions of Windows 11 Pro, Enterprise, and EDU. However, you need to have Microsoft 365 Copilot installed, among other conditions.

items.title: GPU crisis hits Japan as RTX 5060 Ti and up are in short supply โ GPUs sell out as soon as they arrive
items.summary: Multiple shops are reportedly saying that GPUs are selling almost as soon as they arrive, with higher-end models becoming increasingly challenging to keep in stock.

items.title: HP reportedly eyes Chinese suppliers for DRAM as global shortage sparks shake-up โ analyst says memory chips are commodities that can easily be replaced
items.summary: A tech analyst claims that HP told the Bank of America that it's considering buying memory chips from China to help alleviate the ongoing shortage.

items.title: Asus adds 64MB ROM to Strix Neo AM5 motherboards, following Gigabyte โ capacity large enough to fit pre-installed Wi-Fi drivers
items.summary: Asus has incorporated a 64MB ROM into its all-new Strix Neo AM5 motherboards to support future Ryzen releases. For now, though, Asus is using the extra capacity to hold an integrated Wi-Fi driver, handy for new Windows 11 installs.

items.title: Steam Machine pricing soars past PS5 Pro and Xbox Series X in new retailer listing โ 1TB SKU shatters $1,000 barrier
items.summary: Czech retailer Smarty has listed Valveโs highly anticipated Steam Machine at $950 for the 512GB version and $1,070 for the 1TB modelโboth before taxes.

items.title: Dev creates selection of UEFI games you have to beat in order to boot your computer โ 10-month project will shut down your PC if you lose
items.summary: Dev creates a quintet of UEFI games with the premise of Win -> Boot, Lose -> Shutdown.

items.title: This $2,000 Bitcoin mining water heater can pay for itself by slashing your energy bills, company claims โ can rake in $1,000 a year in BTC, offset 80% of electricity and water costs
items.summary: Superheat was at CES 2026 to showcase what it describes as โa water heater that pays for itself.โ Instead of a resistive heating element, it warms your H2O with heat generated by a Bitcoin ASIC miner.

items.title: Jensen Huang discusses the economics of inference, power delivery, and more at CES 2026 press Q&A session โ 'You sell a chip one time, but when you build software, you maintain it forever'
items.summary: In a press Q&A at CES 2026, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang addressed everything from Rubinโs design philosophy to inference economics, power constraints, open models, and more.

items.title: Nvidia hires first-ever CMO, snatches former Google exec for the tough job of helping sell more chips โ Alison Wagonfield spent nearly 10 years at Google building its Cloud project
items.summary: As the AI hardware market is about to change, Nvidia is hiring its first chief marketing officer.

items.title: Intel showed up for consumers at the 'Consumer Electronics Show;' AMD didnโt
items.summary: At this year's CES, AMD felt like a dominant force, too focused on AI potential to talk about (or to) consumers. Intel looked more like a laser-focused startup, confidently pitching its Panther Lake chips to gamers, laptop users, and even robot makers.

items.title: Meta inks deals to supply a staggering 6 gigawatts in nuclear power for data center ambitions โ enough wattage to supply 5 million homes
items.summary: The 6GW will come from various suppliers โ both existing and upcoming โ to deliver the estimated 1GW that Meta's Prometheus site will require in 2026, and the 5GW its Hyperion data center will need by 2028.

items.title: Intel Panther Lake press Q&A transcript โ EVO is still alive, and the company ditches prior-generation naming scheme
items.summary: Following Intel's keynote at CES 2026, we attended a press Q&A at CES in Las Vegas, featuring some of the senior staff behind Intel's Panther Lake architecture, with some illuminating commentary about the new products.

items.title: Researchers turn spoiled milk into 3D printing materials โ extracted proteins from dairy waste combined with polymers to create plastic alternative
items.summary: This work turns what would otherwise be an agricultural liability into a potential input for advanced manufacturing.

items.title: Tactics, transfers and turmoil - inside the fall of Amorim
items.summary: After 14 months, Ruben Amorim has been sacked by Manchester United - but where did it all go wrong?

items.title: The story of a successful British WWII deception operation
items.summary: A mocked idea to feed false plans to the Nazis via a drowned corpse is brought to life.

items.title: Booze, beach, beaten - how England lost the Ashes
items.summary: BBC Sport chief cricket reporter Stephan Shemilt reveals the inside story of England's Ashes defeat in Australia on and off the pitch.

items.title: I've realised I can make a difference - Hoy
items.summary: In a new BBC documentary, Sir Chris Hoy shows how he is using his Olympic mindset to reframe his purpose following a terminal cancer diagnosis.

items.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
items.summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

items.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
items.summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

items.title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
items.summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
